associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText: Turbidity thresholds were converted to TSS using regression equations to establish a relationship. The thresholds vary depending on duration of elevated turbidity (consecutive hours). The most conservative value is being used for ATTAINS, which is based on the turbidity threshold for a duration of 720 hours (7 NTU). The TSS target varies for each waterbody depending on the regression equation.
Hardness-dependent aluminum criteria, waterbody specific. TMDLs developed for both chronic and acute criteria. Allocations provided here are for the more conservative chronic criteria.

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText: Sediment translators/thresholds were developed to interpret the narrative standard for "bottom deposits and suspended or settleable solids." These created recommendations for two bedded sediment indicators. In order to write a TMDL, a load-based indicator is needed, so TSS was chosen. The target end point is 18.38 mg/L TSS.
